results.title: Management in hospital
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Confusion in the elderly”.
One of a series about the techniques for management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. This demonstrates a variety of treatments of admission to hospital. Shows actual patients with different presentations of confusion, and outlines basic principles of management designed to allow the patients to get the most out of life.

results.title: Management in the community
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Confusion in the elderly”.
One of a series about the techniques for management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. Traces the case of an elderly woman whose family wants to have her committed to hospital or a home. However, with medical advice it is possible for her to remain at home.

results.title: Man: a course of study
results.brief_description: The course of study is designed for upper primary or lower secondary level but can be introduced effectively at any level. It deals with the basic questions: What is human about human beings? How did they get that way? How can they be made more so?

group_works.title: The Baboon troop
group_works.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and Educational Development Centre

results.title: The Baboon troop
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and Educational Development Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man: a course of study”.
Explores the social structure of members of a baboon troop. Shows the role of the male as the protector and central figure, the females’ bonds of affection for their offspring, and the establishment of the dominance hierarchy among juveniles.

results.title: Man who bypassed death
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
Follows John Duffy through open heart surgery. Without the surgery he would have died within the year. The multiple by-pass operation now-a-days has a low failure rate, but it is still a frightening experience. Duffy and his doctor share their doubts and fears through each stage in the procedure.

results.title: Four minutes to live
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
Presented by Jim Reed, this episode of a weekly television public affairs series focusses on emergency-response healthcare. Subjects include: the need for paramedics in Ontario; Vancouver, Calgary, and Medicine Hat as the only places in Canada with advanced pre-paramedical training and personnel; and patients who have been saved by CPR.

results.title: All in the family
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
Documentary highlighting the value of family therapy. Shows scenes in a controlled therapy session where a girl’s problems are discussed with her family. Discusses certain illnesses such as anorexia nervosa and the approach for dealing with this disease showing the progression of the therapy sessions. No other credits available.
